001package squidpony.squidai;
002
003import squidpony.squidgrid.Direction;
004import squidpony.squidgrid.LOS;
005import squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.DungeonUtility;
006import squidpony.squidmath.LightRNG;
007import squidpony.squidmath.RNG;
008
009import java.awt.Point;
010import java.util.*;
011
012/**
013 * An alternative to AStarSearch when you want to fully explore a search space, or when you want a gradient floodfill.
014 * If you can't remember how to spell this, just remember: Does It Just Know Stuff? That's Really Awesome!
015 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 4/4/2015.
016 */
017public class DijkstraMap
018{
019    /**
020     * The type of heuristic to use.
021     */
022    public enum Measurement {
023
024        /**
025         * The distance it takes when only the four primary directions can be
026         * moved in. The default.
027         */
028        MANHATTAN,
029        /**
030         * The distance it takes when diagonal movement costs the same as
031         * cardinal movement.
032         */
033        CHEBYSHEV,
034        /**
035         * The distance it takes as the crow flies. This will NOT affect movement cost when calculating a path,
036         * only the preferred squares to travel to (resulting in drastically more reasonable-looking paths).
037         */
038        EUCLIDEAN
039    }
040
041    /**
042     * This affects how distance is measured on diagonal directions vs. orthogonal directions. MANHATTAN should form a
043     * diamond shape on a featureless map, while CHEBYSHEV and EUCLIDEAN will form a square. EUCLIDEAN does not affect
044     * the length of paths, though it will change the DijkstraMap's gradientMap to have many non-integer values, and
045     * that in turn will make paths this finds much more realistic and smooth (favoring orthogonal directions unless a
046     * diagonal one is a better option).
047     */
048    public Measurement measurement = Measurement.MANHATTAN;
049
050
051    /**
052     * Stores which parts of the map are accessible and which are not. Should not be changed unless the actual physical
053     * terrain has changed. You should call initialize() with a new map instead of changing this directly.
054     */
055    public double[][] physicalMap;
056    /**
057     * The frequently-changing values that are often the point of using this class; goals will have a value of 0, and
058     * any cells that can have a character reach a goal in n steps will have a value of n. Cells that cannot be
059     * entered because they are solid will have a very high value equal to the WALL constant in this class, and cells
060     * that cannot be entered because they cannot reach a goal will have a different very high value equal to the
061     * DARK constant in this class.
062     */
063    public double[][] gradientMap;
064    /**
065     * Height of the map. Exciting stuff. Don't change this, instead call initialize().
066     */
067    public int height;
068    /**
069     * Width of the map. Exciting stuff. Don't change this, instead call initialize().
070     */
071    public int width;
072    /**
073     * The latest path that was obtained by calling findPath(). It will not contain the value passed as a starting
074     * cell; only steps that require movement will be included, and so if the path has not been found or a valid
075     * path toward a goal is impossible, this ArrayList will be empty.
076     */
077    public ArrayList<Point> path = new ArrayList<Point>();
078    /**
079     * Goals are always marked with 0.
080     */
081    public static final double GOAL = 0.0;
082    /**
083     * Floor cells, which include any walkable cell, are marked with a high number equal to 999200.0 .
084     */
085    public static final double FLOOR = 999200.0;
086    /**
087     * Walls, which are solid no-entry cells, are marked with a high number equal to 999500.0 .
088     */
089    public static final double WALL = 999500.0;
090    /**
091     * This is used to mark cells that the scan couldn't reach, and these dark cells are marked with a high number
092     * equal to 999800.0 .
093     */
094    public static final double DARK = 999800.0;
095    /**
096     * Goals that pathfinding will seek out. The Double value should almost always be 0.0 , the same as the static GOAL
097     * constant in this class.
098     */
099    public HashMap<Point, Double> goals;
100    private HashMap<Point, Double> fresh, closed, open;
101    /**
102     * The RNG used to decide which one of multiple equally-short paths to take.
103     */
104    public RNG rng;
105    private static int frustration = 0;
106
107    public Point[][] targetMap;
108
109
110    private boolean initialized = false;
111    /**
112     * Construct a DijkstraMap without a level to actually scan. If you use this constructor, you must call an
113     * initialize() method before using this class.
114     */
115    public DijkstraMap() {
116        rng = new RNG(new LightRNG());
117        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
118
119        goals = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
120        fresh = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
121        closed = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
122        open = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
123    }
124
125    /**
126     * Construct a DijkstraMap without a level to actually scan. This constructor allows you to specify an RNG before
127     * it is ever used in this class. If you use this constructor, you must call an initialize() method before using
128     * any other methods in the class.
129     */
130    public DijkstraMap(RNG random) {
131        rng = random;
132        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
133
134        goals = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
135        fresh = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
136        closed = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
137        open = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
138    }
139
140    /**
141     * Used to construct a DijkstraMap from the output of another.
142     * @param level
143     */
144    public DijkstraMap(final double[][] level) {
145        rng = new RNG(new LightRNG());
146        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
147
148        goals = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
149        fresh = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
150        closed = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
151        open = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
152        initialize(level);
153    }
154    /**
155     * Used to construct a DijkstraMap from the output of another, specifying a distance calculation.
156     * @param level
157     * @param measurement
158     */
159    public DijkstraMap(final double[][] level, Measurement measurement) {
160        rng = new RNG(new LightRNG());
161        this.measurement = measurement;
162        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
163
164        goals = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
165        fresh = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
166        closed = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
167        open = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
168        initialize(level);
169    }
170
171    /**
172     * Constructor meant to take a char[][] returned by DungeonGen.generate(), or any other
173     * char[][] where '#' means a wall and anything else is a walkable tile. If you only have
174     * a map that uses box-drawing characters, use DungeonUtility.linesToHashes() to get a
175     * map that can be used here.
176     *
177     * @param level
178     */
179    public DijkstraMap(final char[][] level) {
180        rng = new RNG(new LightRNG());
181        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
182
183        goals = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
184        fresh = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
185        closed = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
186        open = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
187        initialize(level);
188    }
189    /**
190     * Constructor meant to take a char[][] returned by DungeonGen.generate(), or any other
191     * char[][] where one char means a wall and anything else is a walkable tile. If you only have
192     * a map that uses box-drawing characters, use DungeonUtility.linesToHashes() to get a
193     * map that can be used here. You can specify the character used for walls.
194     *
195     * @param level
196     */
197    public DijkstraMap(final char[][] level, char alternateWall) {
198        rng = new RNG(new LightRNG());
199        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
200
201        goals = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
202        fresh = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
203        closed = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
204        open = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
205        initialize(level, alternateWall);
206    }
207
208    /**
209     * Constructor meant to take a char[][] returned by DungeonGen.generate(), or any other
210     * char[][] where '#' means a wall and anything else is a walkable tile. If you only have
211     * a map that uses box-drawing characters, use DungeonUtility.linesToHashes() to get a
212     * map that can be used here. This constructor specifies a distance measurement.
213     *
214     * @param level
215     * @param measurement
216     */
217    public DijkstraMap(final char[][] level, Measurement measurement) {
218        rng = new RNG(new LightRNG());
219        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
220        this.measurement = measurement;
221
222        goals = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
223        fresh = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
224        closed = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
225        open = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
226        initialize(level);
227    }
228
229    /**
230     * Used to initialize or re-initialize a DijkstraMap that needs a new PhysicalMap because it either wasn't given
231     * one when it was constructed, or because the contents of the terrain have changed permanently (not if a
232     * creature moved; for that you pass the positions of creatures that block paths to scan() or findPath() ).
233     * @param level
234     * @return
235     */
236    public DijkstraMap initialize(final double[][] level) {
237        width = level.length;
238        height = level[0].length;
239        gradientMap = new double[width][height];
240        physicalMap = new double[width][height];
241        targetMap = new Point[width][height];
242        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
243            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
244                gradientMap[x][y] = level[x][y];
245                physicalMap[x][y] = level[x][y];
246            }
247        }
248        initialized = true;
249        return this;
250    }
251
252    /**
253     * Used to initialize or re-initialize a DijkstraMap that needs a new PhysicalMap because it either wasn't given
254     * one when it was constructed, or because the contents of the terrain have changed permanently (not if a
255     * creature moved; for that you pass the positions of creatures that block paths to scan() or findPath() ).
256     * @param level
257     * @return
258     */
259    public DijkstraMap initialize(final char[][] level) {
260        width = level.length;
261        height = level[0].length;
262        gradientMap = new double[width][height];
263        physicalMap = new double[width][height];
264        targetMap = new Point[width][height];
265        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
266            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
267                double t = (level[x][y] == '#') ? WALL : FLOOR;
268                gradientMap[x][y] = t;
269                physicalMap[x][y] = t;
270            }
271        }
272        initialized = true;
273        return this;
274    }
275
276    /**
277     * Used to initialize or re-initialize a DijkstraMap that needs a new PhysicalMap because it either wasn't given
278     * one when it was constructed, or because the contents of the terrain have changed permanently (not if a
279     * creature moved; for that you pass the positions of creatures that block paths to scan() or findPath() ). This
280     * initialize() method allows you to specify an alternate wall char other than the default character, '#' .
281     * @param level
282     * @param alternateWall
283     * @return
284     */
285    public DijkstraMap initialize(final char[][] level, char alternateWall) {
286        width = level.length;
287        height = level[0].length;
288        gradientMap = new double[width][height];
289        physicalMap = new double[width][height];
290        targetMap = new Point[width][height];
291        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
292            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
293                double t = (level[x][y] == alternateWall) ? WALL : FLOOR;
294                gradientMap[x][y] = t;
295                physicalMap[x][y] = t;
296            }
297        }
298        initialized = true;
299        return this;
300    }
301
302    /**
303     * Resets the gradientMap to its original value from physicalMap.
304     */
305    public void resetMap() {
306        if(!initialized) return;
307        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
308            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
309                gradientMap[x][y] = physicalMap[x][y];
310            }
311        }
312    }
313
314    /**
315     * Resets the targetMap (which is only assigned in the first place if you use findTechniquePath() ).
316     */
317    public void resetTargetMap() {
318        if(!initialized) return;
319        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
320            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
321                targetMap[x][y] = null;
322            }
323        }
324    }
325
326    /**
327     * Resets this DijkstraMap to a state with no goals, no discovered path, and no changes made to gradientMap
328     * relative to physicalMap.
329     */
330    public void reset() {
331        resetMap();
332        goals.clear();
333        path.clear();
334        closed.clear();
335        fresh.clear();
336        open.clear();
337        frustration = 0;
338    }
339
340    /**
341     * Marks a cell as a goal for pathfinding, unless the cell is a wall or unreachable area (then it does nothing).
342     * @param x
343     * @param y
344     */
345    public void setGoal(int x, int y) {
346        if(!initialized) return;
347        if (physicalMap[x][y] > FLOOR) {
348            return;
349        }
350
351        goals.put(new Point(x, y), GOAL);
352    }
353
354    /**
355     * Marks a cell as a goal for pathfinding, unless the cell is a wall or unreachable area (then it does nothing).
356     * @param pt
357     */
358    public void setGoal(Point pt) {
359        if(!initialized) return;
360        if (physicalMap[pt.x][pt.y] > FLOOR) {
361            return;
362        }
363
364        goals.put(pt, GOAL);
365    }
366
367    /**
368     * Marks a specific cell in gradientMap as completely impossible to enter.
369     * @param x
370     * @param y
371     */
372    public void setOccupied(int x, int y) {
373        if(!initialized) return;
374        gradientMap[x][y] = WALL;
375    }
376
377    /**
378     * Reverts a cell to the value stored in the original state of the level as known by physicalMap.
379     * @param x
380     * @param y
381     */
382    public void resetCell(int x, int y) {
383        if(!initialized) return;
384        gradientMap[x][y] = physicalMap[x][y];
385    }
386
387    /**
388     * Reverts a cell to the value stored in the original state of the level as known by physicalMap.
389     * @param pt
390     */
391    public void resetCell(Point pt) {
392        if(!initialized) return;
393        gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] = physicalMap[pt.x][pt.y];
394    }
395
396    /**
397     * Used to remove all goals and undo any changes to gradientMap made by having a goal present.
398     */
399    public void clearGoals() {
400        if(!initialized)
401            return;
402        for (Map.Entry<Point, Double> entry : goals.entrySet()) {
403            resetCell(entry.getKey());
404        }
405        goals.clear();
406    }
407
408    protected void setFresh(int x, int y, double counter) {
409        if(!initialized) return;
410        gradientMap[x][y] = counter;
411        fresh.put(new Point(x, y), counter);
412    }
413
414    protected void setFresh(final Point pt, double counter) {
415        if(!initialized) return;
416        gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] = counter;
417        fresh.put(new Point(pt.x, pt.y), counter);
418    }
419
420    /**
421     * Recalculate the Dijkstra map and return it. Cells that were marked as goals with setGoal will have
422     * a value of 0, the cells adjacent to goals will have a value of 1, and cells progressively further
423     * from goals will have a value equal to the distance from the nearest goal. The exceptions are walls,
424     * which will have a value defined by the WALL constant in this class, and areas that the scan was
425     * unable to reach, which will have a value defined by the DARK constant in this class (typically,
426     * these areas should not be used to place NPCs or items and should be filled with walls). This uses the
427     * current measurement.
428     *
429     * @param impassable A Set of Position keys representing the locations of enemies or other moving obstacles to a
430     *                   path that cannot be moved through; this can be null if there are no such obstacles.
431     * @return A 2D double[width][height] using the width and height of what this knows about the physical map.
432     */
433    public double[][] scan(Set<Point> impassable) {
434        if(!initialized) return null;
435        if(impassable == null)
436            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
437        HashMap<Point, Double> blocking = new HashMap<Point, Double>(impassable.size());
438        for (Point pt : impassable) {
439            blocking.put(pt, WALL);
440        }
441        closed.putAll(blocking);
442
443        for (Map.Entry<Point, Double> entry : goals.entrySet()) {
444            if (closed.containsKey(entry.getKey()))
445                closed.remove(entry.getKey());
446            gradientMap[entry.getKey().x][entry.getKey().y] = entry.getValue();
447        }
448        double currentLowest = 999000;
449        HashMap<Point, Double> lowest = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
450
451        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
452            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
453                if (gradientMap[x][y] > FLOOR && !goals.containsKey(new Point(x, y)))
454                    closed.put(new Point(x, y), physicalMap[x][y]);
455                else if(gradientMap[x][y] < currentLowest)
456                {
457                    currentLowest = gradientMap[x][y];
458                    lowest.clear();
459                    lowest.put(new Point(x, y), currentLowest);
460                }
461                else if(gradientMap[x][y] == currentLowest)
462                {
463                    lowest.put(new Point(x, y), currentLowest);
464                }
465            }
466        }
467        int numAssigned = lowest.size();
468        open.putAll(lowest);
469        Direction[] dirs = (measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN) ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS;
470        while (numAssigned > 0) {
471//            ++iter;
472            numAssigned = 0;
473
474            for (Map.Entry<Point, Double> cell : open.entrySet()) {
475                for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
476                    Point adj = new Point(cell.getKey());
477                    adj.translate(dirs[d].deltaX, dirs[d].deltaY);
478                    double h = heuristic(dirs[d]);
479                    if (!closed.containsKey(adj) && !open.containsKey(adj) && gradientMap[cell.getKey().x][cell.getKey().y] + h < gradientMap[adj.x][adj.y]) {
480                        setFresh(adj, cell.getValue() + h);
481                        ++numAssigned;
482                    }
483                }
484            }
485            closed.putAll(open);
486            open = new HashMap<Point, Double>(fresh);
487            fresh.clear();
488        }
489        closed.clear();
490        open.clear();
491
492        double[][] gradientClone = new double[width][height];
493        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
494            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
495                if (gradientMap[x][y] == FLOOR) {
496                    gradientMap[x][y] = DARK;
497                }
498            }
499            System.arraycopy(gradientMap[x], 0, gradientClone[x], 0, height);
500        }
501
502        return gradientClone;
503    }
504
505    /**
506     * Recalculate the Dijkstra map up to a limit and return it. Cells that were marked as goals with setGoal will have
507     * a value of 0, the cells adjacent to goals will have a value of 1, and cells progressively further
508     * from goals will have a value equal to the distance from the nearest goal. If a cell would take more steps to
509     * reach than the given limit, it will have a value of DARK if it was passable instead of the distance. The
510     * exceptions are walls, which will have a value defined by the WALL constant in this class, and areas that the scan
511     * was unable to reach, which will have a value defined by the DARK constant in this class. This uses the
512     * current measurement.
513     *
514     * @param limit The maximum number of steps to scan outward from a goal.
515     * @param impassable A Set of Position keys representing the locations of enemies or other moving obstacles to a
516     *                   path that cannot be moved through; this can be null if there are no such obstacles.
517     * @return A 2D double[width][height] using the width and height of what this knows about the physical map.
518     */
519    public double[][] partialScan(int limit, Set<Point> impassable) {
520        if(!initialized) return null;
521        if(impassable == null)
522            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
523        HashMap<Point, Double> blocking = new HashMap<Point, Double>(impassable.size());
524        for (Point pt : impassable) {
525            blocking.put(pt, WALL);
526        }
527        closed.putAll(blocking);
528
529        for (Map.Entry<Point, Double> entry : goals.entrySet()) {
530            if (closed.containsKey(entry.getKey()))
531                closed.remove(entry.getKey());
532            gradientMap[entry.getKey().x][entry.getKey().y] = entry.getValue();
533        }
534        double currentLowest = 999000;
535        HashMap<Point, Double> lowest = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
536
537        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
538            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
539                if (gradientMap[x][y] > FLOOR && !goals.containsKey(new Point(x, y)))
540                    closed.put(new Point(x, y), physicalMap[x][y]);
541                else if(gradientMap[x][y] < currentLowest)
542                {
543                    currentLowest = gradientMap[x][y];
544                    lowest.clear();
545                    lowest.put(new Point(x, y), currentLowest);
546                }
547                else if(gradientMap[x][y] == currentLowest)
548                {
549                    lowest.put(new Point(x, y), currentLowest);
550                }
551            }
552        }
553        int numAssigned = lowest.size();
554        open.putAll(lowest);
555        Direction[] dirs = (measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN) ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS;
556        int iter = 0;
557        while (numAssigned > 0 && iter < limit) {
558//            ++iter;
559            numAssigned = 0;
560
561            for (Map.Entry<Point, Double> cell : open.entrySet()) {
562                for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
563                    Point adj = new Point(cell.getKey());
564                    adj.translate(dirs[d].deltaX, dirs[d].deltaY);
565                    double h = heuristic(dirs[d]);
566                    if (!closed.containsKey(adj) && !open.containsKey(adj) && gradientMap[cell.getKey().x][cell.getKey().y] + h < gradientMap[adj.x][adj.y]) {
567                        setFresh(adj, cell.getValue() + h);
568                        ++numAssigned;
569                    }
570                }
571            }
572            closed.putAll(open);
573            open = new HashMap<Point, Double>(fresh);
574            fresh.clear();
575            ++iter;
576        }
577        closed.clear();
578        open.clear();
579
580
581        double[][] gradientClone = new double[width][height];
582        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
583            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
584                if (gradientMap[x][y] == FLOOR) {
585                    gradientMap[x][y] = DARK;
586                }
587            }
588            System.arraycopy(gradientMap[x], 0, gradientClone[x], 0, height);
589        }
590        return gradientClone;
591    }
592
593    /**
594     * Recalculate the Dijkstra map for a creature that is potentially larger than 1x1 cell and return it. The value of
595     * a cell in the returned Dijkstra map assumes that a creature is square, with a side length equal to the passed
596     * size, that its minimum-x, minimum-y cell is the starting cell, and that any cell with a distance number
597     * represents the distance for the creature's minimum-x, minimum-y cell to reach it. Cells that cannot be entered
598     * by the minimum-x, minimum-y cell because of sizing (such as a floor cell next to a maximum-x and/or maximum-y
599     * wall if size is &gt; 1) will be marked as DARK. Cells that were marked as goals with setGoal will have
600     * a value of 0, the cells adjacent to goals will have a value of 1, and cells progressively further
601     * from goals will have a value equal to the distance from the nearest goal. The exceptions are walls,
602     * which will have a value defined by the WALL constant in this class, and areas that the scan was
603     * unable to reach, which will have a value defined by the DARK constant in this class. (typically,
604     * these areas should not be used to place NPCs or items and should be filled with walls). This uses the
605     * current measurement.
606     *
607     * @param impassable A Set of Position keys representing the locations of enemies or other moving obstacles to a
608     *                   path that cannot be moved through; this can be null if there are no such obstacles.
609     * @param size The length of one side of a square creature using this to find a path, i.e. 2 for a 2x2 cell
610     *             creature. Non-square creatures are not supported because turning is really hard.
611     * @return A 2D double[width][height] using the width and height of what this knows about the physical map.
612     */
613    public double[][] scan(Set<Point> impassable, int size) {
614        if(!initialized) return null;
615        if(impassable == null)
616            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
617        HashMap<Point, Double> blocking = new HashMap<Point, Double>(impassable.size());
618        for (Point pt : impassable) {
619            blocking.put(pt, WALL);
620            for(int x = 0; x < size; x++)
621            {
622                for(int y = 0; y < size; y++)
623                {
624                    if(x + y == 0)
625                        continue;
626                    if(gradientMap[pt.x - x][pt.y - y] <= FLOOR)
627                        blocking.put(new Point(pt.x - x, pt.y - y), DARK);
628                }
629            }
630        }
631        closed.putAll(blocking);
632
633        for (Map.Entry<Point, Double> entry : goals.entrySet()) {
634            if (closed.containsKey(entry.getKey()))
635                closed.remove(entry.getKey());
636            gradientMap[entry.getKey().x][entry.getKey().y] = entry.getValue();
637        }
638        double currentLowest = 999000;
639        HashMap<Point, Double> lowest = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
640        Point p = new Point(0, 0), temp = new Point(0, 0);
641        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
642            I_AM_BECOME_DEATH_DESTROYER_OF_WORLDS:
643            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
644                p.x = x;
645                p.y = y;
646                if (gradientMap[x][y] > FLOOR && !goals.containsKey(p)) {
647                    closed.put(new Point(p.x, p.y), physicalMap[x][y]);
648                    if(gradientMap[x][y] == WALL) {
649                        for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
650                            if (x - i < 0)
651                                continue;
652                            temp.x = x - i;
653                            for (int j = 0; j < size; j++) {
654                                temp.y = y - j;
655                                if (y - j < 0 || closed.containsKey(temp))
656                                    continue;
657                                if (gradientMap[temp.x][temp.y] <= FLOOR && !goals.containsKey(temp))
658                                    closed.put(new Point(temp.x, temp.y), DARK);
659                            }
660                        }
661                    }
662                }
663
664                else if(gradientMap[x][y] < currentLowest && !closed.containsKey(p))
665                {
666                    for(int i = 0; i < size; i++)
667                    {
668                        if(x + i >= width)
669                            continue I_AM_BECOME_DEATH_DESTROYER_OF_WORLDS;
670                        temp.x = x + i;
671                        for(int j = 0; j < size; j++)
672                        {
673                            temp.y = y + j;
674                            if(y + j >= height || closed.containsKey(temp))
675                                continue I_AM_BECOME_DEATH_DESTROYER_OF_WORLDS;
676                        }
677                    }
678
679                    currentLowest = gradientMap[x][y];
680                    lowest.clear();
681                    lowest.put(new Point(x, y), currentLowest);
682
683                }
684                else if(gradientMap[x][y] == currentLowest && !closed.containsKey(p))
685                {
686                    if(!closed.containsKey(p)) {
687                        for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
688                            if (x + i >= width)
689                                continue I_AM_BECOME_DEATH_DESTROYER_OF_WORLDS;
690                            temp.x = x + i;
691                            for (int j = 0; j < size; j++) {
692                                temp.y = y + j;
693                                if (y + j >= height || closed.containsKey(temp))
694                                    continue I_AM_BECOME_DEATH_DESTROYER_OF_WORLDS;
695                            }
696                        }
697                        lowest.put(new Point(x, y), currentLowest);
698                    }
699                }
700            }
701        }
702        int numAssigned = lowest.size();
703        open.putAll(lowest);
704        Direction[] dirs = (measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN) ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS;
705        while (numAssigned > 0) {
706            numAssigned = 0;
707            for (Map.Entry<Point, Double> cell : open.entrySet()) {
708                for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
709                    Point adj = new Point(cell.getKey().x, cell.getKey().y);
710                    adj.translate(dirs[d].deltaX, dirs[d].deltaY);
711                    double h = heuristic(dirs[d]);
712                    if (!closed.containsKey(adj) && !open.containsKey(adj) && gradientMap[cell.getKey().x][cell.getKey().y] + h < gradientMap[adj.x][adj.y]) {
713                        setFresh(new Point(adj.x, adj.y), cell.getValue() + h);
714                        ++numAssigned;
715                    }
716                }
717            }
718            closed.putAll(open);
719            open = new HashMap<Point, Double>(fresh);
720            fresh.clear();
721        }
722        closed.clear();
723        open.clear();
724
725
726        double[][] gradientClone = new double[width][height];
727        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
728            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
729                if (gradientMap[x][y] == FLOOR) {
730                    gradientMap[x][y] = DARK;
731                }
732            }
733            System.arraycopy(gradientMap[x], 0, gradientClone[x], 0, height);
734        }
735        return gradientClone;
736    }
737
738    /**
739     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
740     * of Point positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to the closest reachable
741     * goal. The maximum length of the returned list is given by length; if moving the full length of
742     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
743     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
744     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
745     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
746     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
747     *
748     * @param length
749     * @param impassable
750     * @param onlyPassable
751     * @param start
752     * @param targets
753     * @return
754     */
755    public ArrayList<Point> findPath(int length, Set<Point> impassable,
756                                     Set<Point> onlyPassable, Point start, Point... targets) {
757        if(!initialized) return null;
758        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
759        if(impassable == null)
760            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
761        if(onlyPassable == null)
762            onlyPassable = new HashSet<Point>();
763
764        resetMap();
765        for (Point goal : targets) {
766            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
767        }
768        if(goals.isEmpty())
769            return path;
770        scan(impassable);
771        Point currentPos = new Point(start);
772        while (true) {
773            if (frustration > 500) {
774                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
775                break;
776            }
777            double best = 999000;
778            Direction[] dirs = shuffle((measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN)
779                    ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS);
780            int choice = rng.nextInt(dirs.length);
781
782            for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
783                Point pt = new Point(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
784                if(!(pt.x >= 0 && pt.x < width && pt.y >= 0 && pt.y < height))
785                {
786                    continue;
787                }
788                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best) {
789                    best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
790                    choice = d;
791                }
792            }
793            if             (best >= gradientMap[start.x][start.y] || physicalMap[currentPos.x + dirs[choice].deltaX][currentPos.y + dirs[choice].deltaY] > FLOOR) {
794                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
795                break;
796            }
797            currentPos.y += dirs[choice].deltaY;
798            currentPos.x += dirs[choice].deltaX;
799            path.add(new Point(currentPos.x, currentPos.y));
800            frustration++;
801            if (path.size() >= length) {
802                if (onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
803
804                    closed.put(currentPos, WALL);
805                    Set<Point> impassable2 = impassable;
806                    impassable2.add(currentPos);
807                    return findPath(length, impassable2, onlyPassable, start, targets);
808                }
809                break;
810            }
811            if(gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
812                break;
813        }
814        frustration = 0;
815        goals.clear();
816        return path;
817    }
818    /**
819     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
820     * of Point positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to a goal, until preferredRange is
821     * reached, or further from a goal if the preferredRange has not been met at the current distance.
822     * The maximum length of the returned list is given by moveLength; if moving the full length of
823     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
824     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
825     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
826     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
827     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
828     *
829     * @param moveLength
830     * @param preferredRange
831     * @param los a squidgrid.LOS object if the preferredRange should try to stay in line of sight, or null if LoS
832     *            should be disregarded.
833     * @param impassable
834     * @param onlyPassable
835     * @param start
836     * @param targets
837     * @return
838     */
839    public ArrayList<Point> findAttackPath(int moveLength, int preferredRange, LOS los, Set<Point> impassable,
840                                           Set<Point> onlyPassable, Point start, Point... targets) {
841        if(!initialized) return null;
842        if(preferredRange < 0) preferredRange = 0;
843        double[][] resMap = new double[width][height];
844        if(los != null)
845        {
846            for(int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
847                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
848                    resMap[x][y] = (physicalMap[x][y] == WALL) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
849                }
850            }
851        }
852        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
853        if(impassable == null)
854            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
855        if(onlyPassable == null)
856            onlyPassable = new HashSet<Point>();
857
858        resetMap();
859        for (Point goal : targets) {
860            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
861        }
862        if(goals.isEmpty())
863            return path;
864
865        Measurement mess = measurement;
866        if(measurement == Measurement.EUCLIDEAN)
867        {
868            measurement = Measurement.CHEBYSHEV;
869        }
870        scan(impassable);
871        goals.clear();
872
873        for(int x = 0; x < width; x++)
874        {
875            CELL:
876            for(int y = 0; y < height; y++)
877            {
878                if(gradientMap[x][y] == WALL || gradientMap[x][y] == DARK)
879                    continue;
880                if (gradientMap[x][y] == preferredRange && los != null) {
881                    for (Point goal : targets) {
882                        if (los.isReachable(resMap, x, y, goal.x, goal.y)) {
883                            setGoal(x, y);
884                            gradientMap[x][y] = 0;
885                            continue CELL;
886                        }
887                    }
888                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
889                }
890                else
891                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
892            }
893        }
894        measurement = mess;
895        scan(impassable);
896
897        Point currentPos = new Point(start);
898        while (true) {
899            if (frustration > 500) {
900                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
901                break;
902            }
903            double best = 999000;
904            Direction[] dirs = shuffle((measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN)
905                    ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS);
906            int choice = rng.nextInt(dirs.length);
907
908            for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
909                Point pt = new Point(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
910                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best) {
911                    best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
912                    choice = d;
913                }
914            }
915            if             (best >= gradientMap[start.x][start.y] || physicalMap[currentPos.x + dirs[choice].deltaX][currentPos.y + dirs[choice].deltaY] > FLOOR) {
916                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
917                break;
918            }
919            currentPos.y += dirs[choice].deltaY;
920            currentPos.x += dirs[choice].deltaX;
921            path.add(new Point(currentPos.x, currentPos.y));
922            frustration++;
923            if (path.size() >= moveLength) {
924                if (onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
925
926                    closed.put(currentPos, WALL);
927                    Set<Point> impassable2 = impassable;
928                    impassable2.add(currentPos);
929                    return findAttackPath(moveLength, preferredRange, los, impassable2, onlyPassable, start, targets);
930                }
931                break;
932            }
933            if(gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
934                break;
935        }
936        frustration = 0;
937        goals.clear();
938        return path;
939    }
940    /**
941     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
942     * of Point positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to a goal, until a cell is reached with
943     * a distance from a goal that is at least equal to minPreferredRange and no more than maxPreferredRange,
944     * which may go further from a goal if the minPreferredRange has not been met at the current distance.
945     * The maximum length of the returned list is given by moveLength; if moving the full length of
946     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
947     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
948     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
949     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
950     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
951     *
952     * @param moveLength
953     * @param minPreferredRange
954     * @param maxPreferredRange
955     * @param los a squidgrid.LOS object if the preferredRange should try to stay in line of sight, or null if LoS
956     *            should be disregarded.
957     * @param impassable
958     * @param onlyPassable
959     * @param start
960     * @param targets
961     * @return
962     */
963    public ArrayList<Point> findAttackPath(int moveLength, int minPreferredRange, int maxPreferredRange, LOS los,
964                                           Set<Point> impassable, Set<Point> onlyPassable, Point start, Point... targets) {
965        if(!initialized) return null;
966        if(minPreferredRange < 0) minPreferredRange = 0;
967        if(maxPreferredRange < minPreferredRange) maxPreferredRange = minPreferredRange;
968        double[][] resMap = new double[width][height];
969        if(los != null)
970        {
971            for(int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
972                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
973                    resMap[x][y] = (physicalMap[x][y] == WALL) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
974                }
975            }
976        }
977        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
978        if(impassable == null)
979            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
980        if(onlyPassable == null)
981            onlyPassable = new HashSet<Point>();
982
983        resetMap();
984        for (Point goal : targets) {
985            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
986        }
987        if(goals.isEmpty())
988            return path;
989
990        Measurement mess = measurement;
991        if(measurement == Measurement.EUCLIDEAN)
992        {
993            measurement = Measurement.CHEBYSHEV;
994        }
995        scan(impassable);
996        goals.clear();
997
998        for(int x = 0; x < width; x++)
999        {
1000            CELL:
1001            for(int y = 0; y < height; y++)
1002            {
1003                if(gradientMap[x][y] == WALL || gradientMap[x][y] == DARK)
1004                    continue;
1005                if (gradientMap[x][y] >= minPreferredRange && gradientMap[x][y] <= maxPreferredRange) {
1006
1007                    for (Point goal : targets) {
1008                        if (los == null || los.isReachable(resMap, x, y, goal.x, goal.y)) {
1009                            setGoal(x, y);
1010                            gradientMap[x][y] = 0;
1011                            continue CELL;
1012                        }
1013                    }
1014                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
1015                }
1016                else
1017                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
1018            }
1019        }
1020        measurement = mess;
1021        scan(impassable);
1022
1023        Point currentPos = new Point(start);
1024        while (true) {
1025            if (frustration > 500) {
1026                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1027                break;
1028            }
1029            double best = 999000;
1030            Direction[] dirs = shuffle((measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN)
1031                    ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS);
1032            int choice = rng.nextInt(dirs.length);
1033
1034            for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
1035                Point pt = new Point(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
1036                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best) {
1037                    best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
1038                    choice = d;
1039                }
1040            }
1041            if             (best >= gradientMap[start.x][start.y] || physicalMap[currentPos.x + dirs[choice].deltaX][currentPos.y + dirs[choice].deltaY] > FLOOR) {
1042                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1043                break;
1044            }
1045            currentPos.y += dirs[choice].deltaY;
1046            currentPos.x += dirs[choice].deltaX;
1047            path.add(new Point(currentPos.x, currentPos.y));
1048            frustration++;
1049            if (path.size() >= moveLength) {
1050                if (onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
1051
1052                    closed.put(currentPos, WALL);
1053                    impassable.add(currentPos);
1054                    return findAttackPath(moveLength, minPreferredRange, maxPreferredRange, los, impassable,
1055                            onlyPassable, start, targets);
1056                }
1057                break;
1058            }
1059            if(gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
1060                break;
1061        }
1062        frustration = 0;
1063        goals.clear();
1064        return path;
1065    }
1066
1067    /**
1068     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
1069     * of Point positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to a goal, where goals are
1070     * considered valid if they are at a valid range for the given Technique to hit at least one target
1071     * and ideal if that Technique can affect as many targets as possible from a cell that can be moved
1072     * to with at most movelength steps.
1073     *
1074     * The return value of this method is the path to get to a location to attack, but on its own it
1075     * does not tell the user how to perform the attack.  It does set the targetMap 2D Point array field
1076     * so that if your position at the end of the returned path is non-null in targetMap, it will be
1077     * a Point that can be used as a target position for Technique.apply() . If your position at the end
1078     * of the returned path is null, then an ideal attack position was not reachable by the path.
1079     *
1080     * This needs a char[][] dungeon as an argument because DijkstraMap does not always have a char[][]
1081     * version of the map available to it, and certain AOE implementations that a Technique uses may
1082     * need a char[][] specifically to determine what they affect.
1083     *
1084     * The maximum length of the returned list is given by moveLength; if moving the full length of
1085     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in allies
1086     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
1087     * movement scenarios, and is also used considered an undesirable thing to affect for the Technique),
1088     * it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
1089     *
1090     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
1091     * through, and will be ignored if there is a target overlapping one.
1092     *
1093     * @param moveLength the maximum distance to try to pathfind out to; if a spot to use a Technique can be found
1094     *                   while moving no more than this distance, then the targetMap field in this object will have a
1095     *                   target Point that is ideal for the given Technique at the x, y indices corresponding to the
1096     *                   last Point in the returned path.
1097     * @param tech a Technique that we will try to find an ideal place to use, and/or a path toward that place.
1098     * @param dungeon a char 2D array with '#' for walls.
1099     * @param los a squidgrid.LOS object if the preferred range should try to stay in line of sight, or null if LoS
1100     *            should be disregarded.
1101     * @param impassable locations of enemies or mobile hazards/obstacles that aren't in the map as walls
1102     * @param allies called onlyPassable in other methods, here it also represents allies for Technique things
1103     * @param start the Point the pathfinder starts at.
1104     * @param targets a Set of Point, not an array of Point or variable argument list as in other methods.
1105     * @return an ArrayList of Point that represents a path to travel to get to an ideal place to use tech
1106     */
1107    public ArrayList<Point> findTechniquePath(int moveLength, Technique tech, char[][] dungeon, LOS los,
1108                                           Set<Point> impassable, Set<Point> allies, Point start, Set<Point> targets) {
1109        if(!initialized) return null;
1110        tech.setMap(dungeon);
1111        double[][] resMap = new double[width][height];
1112        double[][] worthMap = new double[width][height];
1113        double[][] userDistanceMap = new double[width][height];
1114
1115        LinkedHashSet friends;
1116
1117
1118        for(int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
1119            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
1120                resMap[x][y] = (physicalMap[x][y] == WALL) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
1121                targetMap[x][y] = null;
1122            }
1123        }
1124
1125        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1126        if(targets == null || targets.size() == 0)
1127            return path;
1128        if(impassable == null)
1129            impassable = new LinkedHashSet<Point>();
1130        if(allies == null)
1131            friends = new LinkedHashSet<Point>();
1132        else
1133        {
1134            friends = new LinkedHashSet<Point>(allies);
1135            friends.remove(start);
1136        }
1137
1138        resetMap();
1139        setGoal(start);
1140        userDistanceMap = scan(impassable);
1141        clearGoals();
1142        resetMap();
1143        for (Point goal : targets) {
1144            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
1145        }
1146        if(goals.isEmpty())
1147            return path;
1148
1149        Measurement mess = measurement;
1150        /*
1151        if(measurement == Measurement.EUCLIDEAN)
1152        {
1153            measurement = Measurement.CHEBYSHEV;
1154        }
1155        */
1156        scan(impassable);
1157        clearGoals();
1158
1159        Point tempPt = new Point(0,0);
1160        LinkedHashMap<Point, ArrayList<Point>> ideal;
1161        // generate an array of the single best location to attack when you are in a given cell.
1162        for(int x = 0; x < width; x++)
1163        {
1164            tempPt.x = x;
1165            CELL:
1166            for(int y = 0; y < height; y++)
1167            {
1168                tempPt.y = y;
1169                if(gradientMap[x][y] == WALL || gradientMap[x][y] == DARK || userDistanceMap[x][y] > moveLength * 2.0)
1170                    continue;
1171                if (gradientMap[x][y] >= tech.aoe.getMinRange() && gradientMap[x][y] <= tech.aoe.getMaxRange()) {
1172                    for (Point tgt : targets) {
1173                        if (los == null || los.isReachable(resMap, x, y, tgt.x, tgt.y)) {
1174                            ideal = tech.idealLocations(tempPt, targets, friends);
1175                            // this is weird but it saves the trouble of getting the iterator and checking hasNext() .
1176                            for(Map.Entry<Point, ArrayList<Point>> ip : ideal.entrySet()) {
1177                                targetMap[x][y] = ip.getKey();
1178                                worthMap[x][y] = ip.getValue().size();
1179                                setGoal(x, y);
1180                                gradientMap[x][y] = 0;
1181                                break;
1182                            }
1183                            continue CELL;
1184                        }
1185                    }
1186                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
1187                }
1188                else
1189                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
1190            }
1191        }
1192        scan(impassable);
1193
1194        double currentDistance = gradientMap[start.x][start.y];
1195        if(currentDistance <= moveLength)
1196        {
1197            Point[] g_arr = new Point[goals.size()];
1198            g_arr = goals.keySet().toArray(g_arr);
1199
1200            goals.clear();
1201            setGoal(start);
1202            scan(impassable);
1203            goals.clear();
1204            gradientMap[start.x][start.y] = moveLength;
1205
1206            for (Point g : g_arr) {
1207                if (gradientMap[g.x][g.y] <= moveLength && worthMap[g.x][g.y] > 0) {
1208                    goals.put(g, 0.0 - worthMap[g.x][g.y]);
1209                }
1210            }
1211            resetMap();
1212           /* for(Point g : goals.keySet())
1213            {
1214                gradientMap[g.x][g.y] = 0.0 - worthMap[g.x][g.y];
1215            }*/
1216            scan(impassable);
1217
1218        }
1219
1220        measurement = mess;
1221
1222        Point currentPos = new Point(start.x, start.y);
1223        while (true) {
1224            if (frustration > 500) {
1225                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1226                break;
1227            }
1228            double best = gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y];
1229            Direction[] dirs0 = shuffle((measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN)
1230                    ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS);
1231            Direction[] dirs = Arrays.copyOf(dirs0, dirs0.length + 1);
1232            dirs[dirs0.length] = Direction.NONE;
1233            int choice = rng.nextInt(dirs.length);
1234
1235            for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
1236                Point pt = new Point(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
1237                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best) {
1238                    if (dirs[choice] == Direction.NONE || !path.contains(pt)) {
1239                        best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
1240                        choice = d;
1241                    }
1242                }
1243            }
1244            if(best == gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y])
1245            {
1246                if (friends.contains(currentPos)) {
1247                    closed.put(currentPos, WALL);
1248                    impassable.add(currentPos);
1249                    return findTechniquePath(moveLength, tech, dungeon, los, impassable,
1250                            friends, start, targets);
1251                }
1252                break;
1253            }
1254            if (best > gradientMap[start.x][start.y] || physicalMap[currentPos.x + dirs[choice].deltaX][currentPos.y + dirs[choice].deltaY] > FLOOR) {
1255                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1256                break;
1257            }
1258            currentPos.y += dirs[choice].deltaY;
1259            currentPos.x += dirs[choice].deltaX;
1260            path.add(new Point(currentPos.x, currentPos.y));
1261            frustration++;
1262            if (path.size() >= moveLength) {
1263                if (friends.contains(currentPos)) {
1264                    closed.put(currentPos, WALL);
1265                    impassable.add(currentPos);
1266                    return findTechniquePath(moveLength, tech, dungeon, los, impassable,
1267                            friends, start, targets);
1268                }
1269                break;
1270            }
1271//            if(gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
1272//                break;
1273        }
1274        frustration = 0;
1275        goals.clear();
1276        if(path.isEmpty())
1277            path = findPath(moveLength, impassable, friends, start, DungeonUtility.randomFloor(dungeon),
1278                    DungeonUtility.randomFloor(dungeon), DungeonUtility.randomFloor(dungeon));
1279        return path;
1280    }
1281
1282
1283    private double cachedLongerPaths = 1.2;
1284    private Set<Point> cachedImpassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1285    private Point[] cachedFearSources;
1286    private double[][] cachedFleeMap;
1287    private int cachedSize = 1;
1288    /**
1289     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed fearSources and start point, and returns a list
1290     * of Point positions (using Manhattan distance) needed to get further from the closest fearSources, meant
1291     * for running away. The maximum length of the returned list is given by length; if moving the full
1292     * length of the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
1293     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
1294     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
1295     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
1296     * through, and will be ignored if there is a fearSource overlapping one. The preferLongerPaths parameter
1297     * is meant to be tweaked and adjusted; higher values should make creatures prefer to escape out of
1298     * doorways instead of hiding in the closest corner, and a value of 1.2 should be typical for many maps.
1299     * The parameters preferLongerPaths, impassable, and the varargs used for fearSources will be cached, and
1300     * any subsequent calls that use the same values as the last values passed will avoid recalculating
1301     * unnecessary scans.
1302     *
1303     * @param length
1304     * @param preferLongerPaths Set this to 1.2 if you aren't sure; it will probably need tweaking for different maps.
1305     * @param impassable
1306     * @param onlyPassable
1307     * @param start
1308     * @param fearSources
1309     * @return
1310     */
1311    public ArrayList<Point> findFleePath(int length, double preferLongerPaths, Set<Point> impassable,
1312                                         Set<Point> onlyPassable, Point start, Point... fearSources) {
1313        if (!initialized) return null;
1314        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1315        if (impassable == null)
1316            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1317        if (onlyPassable == null)
1318            onlyPassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1319        if (fearSources == null || fearSources.length < 1) {
1320            path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1321            return path;
1322        }
1323        if (cachedSize == 1 && preferLongerPaths == cachedLongerPaths && impassable.equals(cachedImpassable) &&
1324                fearSources.equals(cachedFearSources)) {
1325            gradientMap = cachedFleeMap;
1326        }
1327        else {
1328            cachedLongerPaths = preferLongerPaths;
1329            cachedImpassable = new HashSet<Point>(impassable);
1330            cachedFearSources = fearSources.clone();
1331            cachedSize = 1;
1332            resetMap();
1333            for (Point goal : fearSources) {
1334                setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
1335            }
1336            if(goals.isEmpty())
1337                return path;
1338
1339            scan(impassable);
1340
1341            for (int x = 0; x < gradientMap.length; x++) {
1342                for (int y = 0; y < gradientMap[x].length; y++) {
1343                    gradientMap[x][y] *= (gradientMap[x][y] >= FLOOR) ? 1.0 : (0.0 - preferLongerPaths);
1344                }
1345            }
1346            scan(impassable);
1347            cachedFleeMap = gradientMap.clone();
1348        }
1349        Point currentPos = new Point(start);
1350        while (true) {
1351            if (frustration > 500) {
1352                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1353                break;
1354            }
1355            double best = 999000;
1356            Direction[] dirs = shuffle((measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN)
1357                    ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS);
1358            int choice = rng.nextInt(dirs.length);
1359
1360            for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
1361                Point pt = new Point(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
1362                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best) {
1363                    best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
1364                    choice = d;
1365                }
1366            }
1367            if             (best >= gradientMap[start.x][start.y] || physicalMap[currentPos.x + dirs[choice].deltaX][currentPos.y + dirs[choice].deltaY] > FLOOR) {
1368                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1369                break;
1370            }
1371            currentPos.y += dirs[choice].deltaY;
1372            currentPos.x += dirs[choice].deltaX;
1373            if(path.size() > 0) {
1374                Point last = path.get(path.size() - 1);
1375                if (gradientMap[last.x][last.y] <= gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y])
1376                    break;
1377            }
1378            path.add(new Point(currentPos.x, currentPos.y));
1379            frustration++;
1380            if (path.size() >= length) {
1381                if (onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
1382
1383                    closed.put(currentPos, WALL);
1384                    Set<Point> impassable2 = impassable;
1385                    impassable2.add(currentPos);
1386                    return findFleePath(length, preferLongerPaths, impassable2, onlyPassable, start, fearSources);
1387                }
1388                break;
1389            }
1390        }
1391        frustration = 0;
1392        goals.clear();
1393        return path;
1394    }
1395    /**
1396     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
1397     * of Point positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to the closest reachable
1398     * goal. The maximum length of the returned list is given by length; if moving the full length of
1399     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
1400     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
1401     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
1402     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
1403     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
1404     * The parameter size refers to the side length of a square unit, such as 2 for a 2x2 unit. The
1405     * parameter start must refer to the minimum-x, minimum-y cell of that unit if size is &gt; 1, and
1406     * all positions in the returned path will refer to movement of the minimum-x, minimum-y cell.
1407     *
1408     * @param size
1409     * @param length
1410     * @param impassable
1411     * @param onlyPassable
1412     * @param start
1413     * @param targets
1414     * @return
1415     */
1416    public ArrayList<Point> findPathLarge(int size, int length, Set<Point> impassable,
1417                                     Set<Point> onlyPassable, Point start, Point... targets) {
1418        if(!initialized) return null;
1419        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1420        if(impassable == null)
1421            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1422        if(onlyPassable == null)
1423            onlyPassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1424
1425        resetMap();
1426        for (Point goal : targets) {
1427            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
1428        }
1429        if(goals.isEmpty())
1430            return path;
1431
1432        scan(impassable, size);
1433        Point currentPos = new Point(start);
1434        while (true) {
1435            if (frustration > 500) {
1436                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1437                break;
1438            }
1439            double best = 999000;
1440            Direction[] dirs = shuffle((measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN)
1441                    ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS);
1442            int choice = rng.nextInt(dirs.length);
1443
1444            for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
1445                Point pt = new Point(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
1446                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best) {
1447                    best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
1448                    choice = d;
1449                }
1450            }
1451            if             (best >= gradientMap[start.x][start.y] || physicalMap[currentPos.x + dirs[choice].deltaX][currentPos.y + dirs[choice].deltaY] > FLOOR) {
1452                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1453                break;
1454            }
1455            currentPos.y += dirs[choice].deltaY;
1456            currentPos.x += dirs[choice].deltaX;
1457            path.add(new Point(currentPos.x, currentPos.y));
1458            frustration++;
1459            if (path.size() >= length) {
1460                if (onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
1461
1462                    closed.put(currentPos, WALL);
1463                    Set<Point> impassable2 = impassable;
1464                    impassable2.add(currentPos);
1465                    return findPathLarge(size, length, impassable2, onlyPassable, start, targets);
1466                }
1467                break;
1468            }
1469            if(gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
1470                break;
1471        }
1472        frustration = 0;
1473        goals.clear();
1474        return path;
1475    }
1476    /**
1477     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
1478     * of Point positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to a goal, until preferredRange is
1479     * reached, or further from a goal if the preferredRange has not been met at the current distance.
1480     * The maximum length of the returned list is given by moveLength; if moving the full length of
1481     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
1482     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
1483     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
1484     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
1485     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
1486     * The parameter size refers to the side length of a square unit, such as 2 for a 2x2 unit. The
1487     * parameter start must refer to the minimum-x, minimum-y cell of that unit if size is &gt; 1, and
1488     * all positions in the returned path will refer to movement of the minimum-x, minimum-y cell.
1489     *
1490     * @param moveLength
1491     * @param preferredRange
1492     * @param los a squidgrid.LOS object if the preferredRange should try to stay in line of sight, or null if LoS
1493     *            should be disregarded.
1494     * @param impassable
1495     * @param onlyPassable
1496     * @param start
1497     * @param targets
1498     * @return
1499     */
1500    public ArrayList<Point> findAttackPathLarge(int size, int moveLength, int preferredRange, LOS los, Set<Point> impassable,
1501                                           Set<Point> onlyPassable, Point start, Point... targets) {
1502        if(!initialized) return null;
1503        if(preferredRange < 0) preferredRange = 0;
1504        double[][] resMap = new double[width][height];
1505        if(los != null)
1506        {
1507            for(int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
1508                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
1509                    resMap[x][y] = (physicalMap[x][y] == WALL) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
1510                }
1511            }
1512        }
1513        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1514        if(impassable == null)
1515            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1516        if(onlyPassable == null)
1517            onlyPassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1518
1519        resetMap();
1520        for (Point goal : targets) {
1521            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
1522        }
1523        if(goals.isEmpty())
1524            return path;
1525
1526        Measurement mess = measurement;
1527        if(measurement == Measurement.EUCLIDEAN)
1528        {
1529            measurement = Measurement.CHEBYSHEV;
1530        }
1531        scan(impassable, size);
1532        goals.clear();
1533
1534        for(int x = 0; x < width; x++)
1535        {
1536            CELL:
1537            for(int y = 0; y < height; y++)
1538            {
1539                if(gradientMap[x][y] == WALL || gradientMap[x][y] == DARK)
1540                    continue;
1541                if (x+2 < width && y + 2 < height && gradientMap[x][y] == preferredRange && los != null) {
1542                    for (Point goal : targets) {
1543                        if (los.isReachable(resMap, x, y, goal.x, goal.y)
1544                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x+1, y, goal.x, goal.y)
1545                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x, y+1, goal.x, goal.y)
1546                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x+1, y+1, goal.x, goal.y)) {
1547                            setGoal(x, y);
1548                            gradientMap[x][y] = 0;
1549                            continue CELL;
1550                        }
1551                    }
1552                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
1553                }
1554                else
1555                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
1556            }
1557        }
1558        measurement = mess;
1559        scan(impassable, size);
1560
1561        Point currentPos = new Point(start);
1562        while (true) {
1563            if (frustration > 500) {
1564                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1565                break;
1566            }
1567            double best = 999000;
1568            Direction[] dirs = shuffle((measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN)
1569                    ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS);
1570            int choice = rng.nextInt(dirs.length);
1571
1572            for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
1573                Point pt = new Point(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
1574                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best) {
1575                    best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
1576                    choice = d;
1577                }
1578            }
1579            if             (best >= gradientMap[start.x][start.y] || physicalMap[currentPos.x + dirs[choice].deltaX][currentPos.y + dirs[choice].deltaY] > FLOOR) {
1580                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1581                break;
1582            }
1583            currentPos.y += dirs[choice].deltaY;
1584            currentPos.x += dirs[choice].deltaX;
1585            path.add(new Point(currentPos.x, currentPos.y));
1586            frustration++;
1587            if (path.size() >= moveLength) {
1588                if (onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
1589
1590                    closed.put(currentPos, WALL);
1591                    Set<Point> impassable2 = impassable;
1592                    impassable2.add(currentPos);
1593                    return findAttackPathLarge(size, moveLength, preferredRange, los, impassable2, onlyPassable, start, targets);
1594                }
1595                break;
1596            }
1597            if(gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
1598                break;
1599        }
1600        frustration = 0;
1601        goals.clear();
1602        return path;
1603    }
1604    /**
1605     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
1606     * of Point positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to a goal, until a cell is reached with
1607     * a distance from a goal that is at least equal to minPreferredRange and no more than maxPreferredRange,
1608     * which may go further from a goal if the minPreferredRange has not been met at the current distance.
1609     * The maximum length of the returned list is given by moveLength; if moving the full length of
1610     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
1611     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
1612     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
1613     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
1614     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
1615     * The parameter size refers to the side length of a square unit, such as 2 for a 2x2 unit. The
1616     * parameter start must refer to the minimum-x, minimum-y cell of that unit if size is &gt; 1, and
1617     * all positions in the returned path will refer to movement of the minimum-x, minimum-y cell.
1618     *
1619     * @param size
1620     * @param moveLength
1621     * @param minPreferredRange
1622     * @param maxPreferredRange
1623     * @param los a squidgrid.LOS object if the preferredRange should try to stay in line of sight, or null if LoS
1624     *            should be disregarded.
1625     * @param impassable
1626     * @param onlyPassable
1627     * @param start
1628     * @param targets
1629     * @return
1630     */
1631    public ArrayList<Point> findAttackPathLarge(int size, int moveLength, int minPreferredRange, int maxPreferredRange, LOS los,
1632                                           Set<Point> impassable, Set<Point> onlyPassable, Point start, Point... targets) {
1633        if(!initialized) return null;
1634        if(minPreferredRange < 0) minPreferredRange = 0;
1635        if(maxPreferredRange < minPreferredRange) maxPreferredRange = minPreferredRange;
1636        double[][] resMap = new double[width][height];
1637        if(los != null)
1638        {
1639            for(int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
1640                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
1641                    resMap[x][y] = (physicalMap[x][y] == WALL) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
1642                }
1643            }
1644        }
1645        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1646        if(impassable == null)
1647            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1648        if(onlyPassable == null)
1649            onlyPassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1650
1651        resetMap();
1652        for (Point goal : targets) {
1653            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
1654        }
1655        if(goals.isEmpty())
1656            return path;
1657
1658        Measurement mess = measurement;
1659        if(measurement == Measurement.EUCLIDEAN)
1660        {
1661            measurement = Measurement.CHEBYSHEV;
1662        }
1663        scan(impassable, size);
1664        goals.clear();
1665
1666        for(int x = 0; x < width; x++)
1667        {
1668            CELL:
1669            for(int y = 0; y < height; y++)
1670            {
1671                if(gradientMap[x][y] == WALL || gradientMap[x][y] == DARK)
1672                    continue;
1673                if (x+2 < width && y + 2 < height && gradientMap[x][y] >= minPreferredRange && gradientMap[x][y] <= maxPreferredRange
1674                        && los != null) {
1675                    for (Point goal : targets) {
1676                        if (los.isReachable(resMap, x, y, goal.x, goal.y)
1677                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x+1, y, goal.x, goal.y)
1678                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x, y+1, goal.x, goal.y)
1679                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x+1, y+1, goal.x, goal.y)) {
1680                            setGoal(x, y);
1681                            gradientMap[x][y] = 0;
1682                            continue CELL;
1683                        }
1684                    }
1685                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
1686                }
1687                else
1688                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
1689            }
1690        }
1691        measurement = mess;
1692        scan(impassable, size);
1693
1694        Point currentPos = new Point(start);
1695        while (true) {
1696            if (frustration > 500) {
1697                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1698                break;
1699            }
1700            double best = 999000;
1701            Direction[] dirs = shuffle((measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN)
1702                    ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS);
1703            int choice = rng.nextInt(dirs.length);
1704
1705            for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
1706                Point pt = new Point(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
1707                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best) {
1708                    best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
1709                    choice = d;
1710                }
1711            }
1712            if             (best >= gradientMap[start.x][start.y] || physicalMap[currentPos.x + dirs[choice].deltaX][currentPos.y + dirs[choice].deltaY] > FLOOR) {
1713                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1714                break;
1715            }
1716            currentPos.y += dirs[choice].deltaY;
1717            currentPos.x += dirs[choice].deltaX;
1718            path.add(new Point(currentPos.x, currentPos.y));
1719            frustration++;
1720            if (path.size() >= moveLength) {
1721                if (onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
1722
1723                    closed.put(currentPos, WALL);
1724                    Set<Point> impassable2 = impassable;
1725                    impassable2.add(currentPos);
