1726                    return findAttackPathLarge(size, moveLength, minPreferredRange, maxPreferredRange, los, impassable2,
1727                            onlyPassable, start, targets);
1728                }
1729                break;
1730            }
1731            if(gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
1732                break;
1733        }
1734        frustration = 0;
1735        goals.clear();
1736        return path;
1737    }
1738
1739    /**
1740     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed fearSources and start point, and returns a list
1741     * of Point positions (using Manhattan distance) needed to get further from the closest fearSources, meant
1742     * for running away. The maximum length of the returned list is given by length; if moving the full
1743     * length of the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
1744     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
1745     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
1746     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
1747     * through, and will be ignored if there is a fearSource overlapping one. The preferLongerPaths parameter
1748     * is meant to be tweaked and adjusted; higher values should make creatures prefer to escape out of
1749     * doorways instead of hiding in the closest corner, and a value of 1.2 should be typical for many maps.
1750     * The parameters size, preferLongerPaths, impassable, and the varargs used for fearSources will be cached, and
1751     * any subsequent calls that use the same values as the last values passed will avoid recalculating
1752     * unnecessary scans. Calls to findFleePath will cache as if size is 1, and may share a cache with this function.
1753     * The parameter size refers to the side length of a square unit, such as 2 for a 2x2 unit. The
1754     * parameter start must refer to the minimum-x, minimum-y cell of that unit if size is &gt; 1, and
1755     * all positions in the returned path will refer to movement of the minimum-x, minimum-y cell.
1756     *
1757     * @param size
1758     * @param length
1759     * @param preferLongerPaths Set this to 1.2 if you aren't sure; it will probably need tweaking for different maps.
1760     * @param impassable
1761     * @param onlyPassable
1762     * @param start
1763     * @param fearSources
1764     * @return
1765     */
1766    public ArrayList<Point> findFleePathLarge(int size, int length, double preferLongerPaths, Set<Point> impassable,
1767                                         Set<Point> onlyPassable, Point start, Point... fearSources) {
1768        if (!initialized) return null;
1769        path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1770        if (impassable == null)
1771            impassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1772        if (onlyPassable == null)
1773            onlyPassable = new HashSet<Point>();
1774        if (fearSources == null || fearSources.length < 1) {
1775            path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1776            return path;
1777        }
1778        if (size == cachedSize && preferLongerPaths == cachedLongerPaths && impassable.equals(cachedImpassable)
1779                && fearSources.equals(cachedFearSources)) {
1780            gradientMap = cachedFleeMap;
1781        }
1782        else {
1783            cachedLongerPaths = preferLongerPaths;
1784            cachedImpassable = new HashSet<Point>(impassable);
1785            cachedFearSources = fearSources.clone();
1786            cachedSize = size;
1787            resetMap();
1788            for (Point goal : fearSources) {
1789                setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
1790            }
1791            if(goals.isEmpty())
1792                return path;
1793
1794            scan(impassable, size);
1795
1796            for (int x = 0; x < gradientMap.length; x++) {
1797                for (int y = 0; y < gradientMap[x].length; y++) {
1798                    gradientMap[x][y] *= (gradientMap[x][y] >= FLOOR) ? 1.0 : (0.0 - preferLongerPaths);
1799                }
1800            }
1801            scan(impassable, size);
1802            cachedFleeMap = gradientMap.clone();
1803        }
1804        Point currentPos = new Point(start);
1805        while (true) {
1806            if (frustration > 500) {
1807                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1808                break;
1809            }
1810            double best = 999000;
1811            Direction[] dirs = shuffle((measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN)
1812                    ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS);
1813            int choice = rng.nextInt(dirs.length);
1814
1815            for (int d = 0; d < dirs.length; d++) {
1816                Point pt = new Point(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
1817                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best) {
1818                    best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
1819                    choice = d;
1820                }
1821            }
1822            if             (best >= gradientMap[start.x][start.y] || physicalMap[currentPos.x + dirs[choice].deltaX][currentPos.y + dirs[choice].deltaY] > FLOOR) {
1823                path = new ArrayList<Point>();
1824                break;
1825            }
1826            currentPos.y += dirs[choice].deltaY;
1827            currentPos.x += dirs[choice].deltaX;
1828            if(path.size() > 0) {
1829                Point last = path.get(path.size() - 1);
1830                if (gradientMap[last.x][last.y] <= gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y])
1831                    break;
1832            }
1833            path.add(new Point(currentPos.x, currentPos.y));
1834            frustration++;
1835            if (path.size() >= length) {
1836                if (onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
1837
1838                    closed.put(currentPos, WALL);
1839                    Set<Point> impassable2 = impassable;
1840                    impassable2.add(currentPos);
1841                    return findFleePathLarge(size, length, preferLongerPaths, impassable2, onlyPassable, start, fearSources);
1842                }
1843                break;
1844            }
1845        }
1846        frustration = 0;
1847        goals.clear();
1848        return path;
1849    }
1850
1851    /**
1852     * A simple limited flood-fill that returns a HashMap of Point keys to the Double values in the DijkstraMap, only
1853     * calculating out to a number of steps determined by limit. This can be useful if you need many flood-fills and
1854     * don't need a large area for each, or if you want to have an effect spread to a certain number of cells away.
1855     * @param radius the number of steps to take outward from each starting position.
1856     * @param starts a vararg group of Points to step outward from; this often will only need to be one Point.
1857     * @return A HashMap of Point keys to Double values; the starts are included in this with the value 0.0.
1858     */
1859    public HashMap<Point, Double> floodFill(int radius, Point... starts) {
1860        if(!initialized) return null;
1861        HashMap<Point, Double> fill = new HashMap<Point, Double>();
1862
1863        resetMap();
1864        for (Point goal : starts) {
1865            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
1866        }
1867        if(goals.isEmpty())
1868            return fill;
1869
1870        partialScan(radius, null);
1871        double temp;
1872        for(int x = 1; x < width - 1; x++)
1873        {
1874            for(int y = 1; y < height - 1; y++)
1875            {
1876                temp = gradientMap[x][y];
1877                if(temp < FLOOR)
1878                {
1879                    fill.put(new Point(x, y), temp);
1880                }
1881            }
1882        }
1883        goals.clear();
1884        return fill;
1885    }
1886
1887    /**
1888     * Shuffle a Direction array, useful for making a path more random.
1889     * @param dirs an array of Directions; will not be modified
1890     * @return a shuffled copy of dirs
1891     */
1892    public Direction[] shuffle(Direction[] dirs)
1893    {
1894        Direction[] array = dirs.clone();
1895        int n = array.length;
1896        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
1897        {
1898            int r = i + (int)(rng.nextDouble() * (n - i));
1899            Direction d = array[r];
1900            array[r] = array[i];
1901            array[i] = d;
1902        }
1903        return array;
1904    }
1905    private static final double root2 = Math.sqrt(2.0);
1906    private double heuristic(Direction target) {
1907        switch (measurement) {
1908            case MANHATTAN:
1909            case CHEBYSHEV:
1910                return 1.0;
1911            case EUCLIDEAN:
1912                switch (target) {
1913                    case DOWN_LEFT:
1914                    case DOWN_RIGHT:
1915                    case UP_LEFT:
1916                    case UP_RIGHT:
1917                        return root2;
1918                    default:
1919                        return  1.0;
1920                }
1921        }
1922        return 1.0;
1923    }
1924}
